info.description:
This section documents the main APIs for interfacing with CorTenX.
Depending on how your system is deployed, these APIs may or may not be publicly available, and you might need additional API keys or authorization tokens from an IDP.

The API documentation is divided into these sections:

* Account: Wallet endpoints for retrieving an account's holdings, access controls, and transaction history.
* Inventory: Issuer endpoints for retrieving inventory-related details.
* Access: Issuer endpoints for retrieving access control related details.
* System information: General endpoints for accessing the block storage, and system-wide status and definitions.
* Transaction request: Endpoints that facilitate transaction requests using binary encoded, signed messages.
* Unsigned transaction request: Endpoints that facilitate transaction requests using OIDC authorization tokens.
* Wallet: Wallet-specific functions for signing pending transactions, transaction proofs, etc...

The JSON encoding of requests and responses use a text representation for some internal simple types.
This includes:
* `AccountId` is represented as `0x` followed by the hexadecimal representation of the AccountId's bytes.
* `ProductId`, `ProductItemId`, `EscrowId`, `BlockAndIndex`, and similar are represented as `x:y` where x is the `blockNumber` and y is the index within the block.
* `TransactionId` is represented as `0x` followed by the hexadecimal representation of the `TransactionId` bytes
* All other binary data uses standard base64 encoding.

General API Request Limits:
* Max URI: 1024 bytes
* Max Body: 262144 bytes (256 KiB)
* Max Query String: 4096 bytes
* Max Cookie size: 10240 bytes

Upload URIs Limits:
* Max Body: 10485760 bytes (10 MiB)
info.title: Trovio CorTenX APIs

tags.description:
The Account API provides endpoints that return information in the scope of holdings of an account.
Initially, a client will want to retrieve information about the access key used to authenticate to the 
system and retrieve the accessible account permissions. Balance endpoints are provided to retrieve
current balances and holdings. Historic endpoints provide transaction history queries.
tags.name: Account

tags.description: The Inventory API is available for Issuers and provides endpoints to query current inventory of product.
tags.name: Product inventory

tags.description:
The Access API is available for Issuers and provides endpoints to query account group and security group
information.
tags.name: Access

tags.description: The System Info API provides general status and information endpoints.
tags.name: System info

tags.description:
The Transaction Request API allows clients to queue transaction requests. The transaction request
data is binary-encoded using the Yabor encoding and signed using the client's access key. Invalid requests
will return an HTTP error code immediately. Valid requests that have incomplete signatures will be stored
as a pending request and other signatories will be notified.
tags.name: Transaction request

tags.description:
The Unsigned Transaction Request API allows clients to queue transaction requests using JSON encoding and
an Authorization Token from a registered OIDC provider. The transaction request is encoded and signed by
the service, after which it is processed in the same way as a signed transaction requests.
tags.name: Unsigned transaction request

tags.description:
The Wallet API provides various endpoints for other functions of the wallet host. This includes pending 
transaction management and limited metadata access.
tags.name: Wallet functions

tags.description:
The Metadata API provides endpoints to define and manager issuer metadata. This includes 
private(limited access) and public metadata values of different types.
tags.name: Metadata

post.description: Creates a new account with full access to the requested account.

200.description: Account(s) were created and details returned.

403.description: Access denied. The request was authenticated but the requesting account(s) do not have the required access permission.

409.description: The request could not be processed.

504.description: The transaction request was submitted but no response was received.

post.summary: Creates a new account with full access to the requested account.

post.description:
Sign and submit transaction request.
 Encodes and signs the request data and submits the request.
 The token provided in the `Authorization` header is verified and the user id is mapped to a generated key
 in the secure key storage.

 #### Errors specific to the endpoint
 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [UserNotFound] | The user identified by the authorization token was not found. |
 | [TooManyRequests] | Too many concurrent requests. Back off and try again later |
 | [AccessKeyIdIncorrectForSignatureRequest] | The provided access key id does not match the authenticated user's account id |
 | [InternalError] | An internal error occurred during execution |
 | [IncorrectAccountId] | The `accountId` or `accessKeyId` provided does not match the public key |
 | [IncorrectSignature] | A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed)|
 | [InvalidSignature] | The signature data supplied was not a valid signature for the key type |
 | [IncorrectSignatureType] | The signature type is not supported for the key type |
 | [IncorrectTransactionId] | The transaction id in the request does not match the hash of the encoded transaction data |

201.description: The transaction request requires more approval signatures and has been stored as a 'pending transaction' and possible approvers have been notified.

202.description: The transaction request was valid and has been queued for processing.

208.description: The transaction request was already processed. The result returned is the result of the previous processing.

403.description: Access denied. The request was authenticated but the requesting account(s) do not have the required access permission.

409.description: The request could not be processed.

post.description:
Sign and submit transaction request (synchronous).
 Encodes and signs the request data and submits the request.
 The token provided in the `Authorization` header is verified and the user id is mapped to a generated key
 in the secure key storage.
 NOTE: This endpoint returns the response after the transaction request has been processed, which requires the
 service to wait for the response. Use this endpoint only for development and testing.

 #### Errors specific to the endpoint
 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [UserNotFound] | The user identified by the authorization token was not found. |
 | [TooManyRequests] | Too many concurrent requests. Back off and try again later |
 | [AccessKeyIdIncorrectForSignatureRequest] | The provided access key id does not match the authenticated user's account id |
 | [InternalError] | An internal error occurred during execution |
 | [IncorrectAccountId] | The `accountId` or `accessKeyId` provided does not match the public key |
 | [IncorrectSignature] | A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed)|
 | [InvalidSignature] | The signature data supplied was not a valid signature for the key type |
 | [IncorrectSignatureType] | The signature type is not supported for the key type |
 | [IncorrectTransactionId] | The transaction id in the request does not match the hash of the encoded transaction data |

200.description: The transaction request was processed and the response is returned.

201.description: The transaction request requires more approval signatures and has been stored as a 'pending transaction' and possible approvers have been notified.

208.description: The transaction request was already processed. The result returned is the result of the previous processing.

403.description: Access denied. The request was authenticated but the requesting account(s) do not have the required access permission.

409.description: The request could not be processed.

504.description: The transaction request was submitted but no response was received.

post.description:
Sign a transaction request.
 Encodes and signs the request data and returns the signed encoded version. The response can be used with the
 [CoreSignedTransactionApi.submitTransaction] endpoint, so the flow is the same for requests signed
 by the service and requests signed by the client.

 #### Errors specific to the endpoint
 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [UserNotFound] | The user identified by the authorization token was not found. |
 | [TooManyRequests] | Too many concurrent requests. Back off and try again later |
 | [AccessKeyIdIncorrectForSignatureRequest] | The provided access key id does not match the authenticated user's account id |
 | [InternalError] | An internal error occurred during execution |
 | [IncorrectAccountId] | The `accountId` or `accessKeyId` provided does not match the public key |
 | [IncorrectSignature] | A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed)|
 | [InvalidSignature] | The signature data supplied was not a valid signature for the key type |
 | [IncorrectSignatureType] | The signature type is not supported for the key type |
 | [IncorrectTransactionId] | The transaction id in the request does not match the hash of the encoded transaction data |

200.description: Response contains the signed transaction request.

403.description: Access denied. The request was authenticated but the requesting account(s) do not have the required access permission.

409.description: The request could not be processed.

get.description:
Retrieve user account details.
 Retrieve details for the user authenticated by the authentication token. If the user does not have an access key
 yet, a new one is generated and the accessKeyId is returned in the response.

200.description: The presented Authorization token was valid, and the associated user data is returned.

403.description: Access denied. The request was authenticated but the requesting account(s) do not have the required access permission.

409.description: The request could not be processed.

get.description:
Get system configuration.
 Returns details required for authentication and connection to the APIs.

 There is no authentication or endpoint permission required for this endpoint.

Query metadata definitions.

 Returns metadata definitions that match the given criteria.
#### Endpoint Permission
This endpoint requires `Request` permission for endpoint type `QueryMetadataDefinitions`, assigned by the accounts 
in one of the following fields (in order of precedence).

| Request parameter   | Description   |
| ------------------- | ------------- |
| `issuerIds` | Assigned by an issuer permits queries of that issuer's definitions. |

Any metadata references contained in the request require `Product` permission from the issuer of the metadata.

parameters.name: issuerIds

parameters.description: Query metadata with the following metadata tags
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: Metadata definition name criterion
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Query metadata of the follow reference type.
parameters.name: entityTypes

parameters.description: Query metadata by value type
parameters.name: valueTypes

parameters.description: Query only indexed or non indexed metadata definitions
parameters.name: indexed

parameters.description: Query only user(`isUser=true`) or issuer metadata(`isUser=false`) definitions
parameters.name: user

parameters.description: Query only audited or not audited metadata definitions
parameters.name: audited

parameters.description: Query metadata definitions with audited values
parameters.name: auditValues

parameters.description: Include metadata for referenced entities (issuerIds)
parameters.name: includeMetadata

parameters.description:
'From' value start the next query from (inclusive).
 This value is returned in the `nextPage` field of the previous response.
 If not specified, the first result page is returned.
 There are two possible formats for the continuation token:
 - `block:index` in case the results are ordered by default block order
 - `maxBlock-index` in case results have a different order. The maxBlock part indicates the maximum block for
 possible results to ensure the next query is stable.
 - `index` the integer value of the first index of the requested page. Works with calls that
 aren't paged using block and index.
parameters.name: page.from

parameters.description:
Limit for number of results returned. If no limit is specified, the system will apply a default depending
 on the query. If a limit of zero is given, the query will not return any results. The query is not guaranteed
 to return up to the limit number of result entries if more are available. Whether more results are available
 is indicated by the presence of the `nextPage` field in the response.
parameters.name: page.limit

parameters.description: Set to `true` to include a total count of results that match the criteria in the response.
parameters.name: page.withCount

parameters.description: Optional header containing the selected user account ID when using IDP JWT tokens in the `Authorization` header. The authenticated key needs to have access to this account (type can be FULL, PRIMARY or SECONDARY). If this header is absent, the user account ID defaults to the access key ID. Requests that use CorTenX access tokens (instead of JWT) should not provide this header as the selected user account ID is already encoded in the token.
parameters.name: X-Trovio-UserAccountId

409.description: The request could not be processed.

post.description:
Create metadata definitions.

 An issuer defines metadata that can be applied to different entity types.
 The request is atomic, if one of the operations fails none of the definitions are created.
 The request is idempotent, if definitions are recreated with the same parameters, the original result is returned.

 The batch size cannot exceed the configured maximum (default: 100).
 If the batch size exceeds the configured maximum a validation failure occurs and the entire request is failed.
#### Endpoint Permission
This endpoint requires `Request` permission for endpoint type `CreateMetadataDefinitions`, assigned by the accounts 
in one of the following fields (in order of precedence).

| Request parameter   | Description   |
| ------------------- | ------------- |
| `issuerId` | Assigned by an issuer permits metadata definitions to be created on the issuer's behalf. |

This endpoint also requires the Issuer Admin to have assigned `Issuer` permission for endpoint type `CreateMetadataDefinitions` to the issuer account(s) referenced by the request.

parameters.description: Optional header containing the selected user account ID when using IDP JWT tokens in the `Authorization` header. The authenticated key needs to have access to this account (type can be FULL, PRIMARY or SECONDARY). If this header is absent, the user account ID defaults to the access key ID. Requests that use CorTenX access tokens (instead of JWT) should not provide this header as the selected user account ID is already encoded in the token.
parameters.name: X-Trovio-UserAccountId

requestBody.description: The metadata definition batch create request

409.description: The request could not be processed.

put.description:
Update metadata definitions.

 The request is atomic, if one of the operations fails none of the definitions are updated.

 The batch size cannot exceed the configured maximum (default: 100).
 If the batch size exceeds the configured maximum a validation failure occurs and the entire request is failed.

 Some properties of metadata definitions can be updated by the issuer.
#### Endpoint Permission
This endpoint requires `Request` permission for endpoint type `UpdateMetadataDefinitions`, assigned by the accounts 
in one of the following fields (in order of precedence).

| Request parameter   | Description   |
| ------------------- | ------------- |
| `updates[].metadataRef` | Assigned by each ref's issuer permits updates. |

parameters.description: Optional header containing the selected user account ID when using IDP JWT tokens in the `Authorization` header. The authenticated key needs to have access to this account (type can be FULL, PRIMARY or SECONDARY). If this header is absent, the user account ID defaults to the access key ID. Requests that use CorTenX access tokens (instead of JWT) should not provide this header as the selected user account ID is already encoded in the token.
parameters.name: X-Trovio-UserAccountId

409.description: The request could not be processed.

post.description:
Upload file.

 Upload a file to temporary storage, to later set a metadata value of type [MetadataValueType.FILE] referencing it.
 Any metadata value referencing this file, needs to belong to the same issuer as the file.

 Note: The file information returned is required when setting a metadata value of type [MetadataValueType.FILE]
 which will reference back to the file by using fields: [MetadataValueFileData.sizeBytes] & [MetadataValueFileData.sha256Hash]
#### Endpoint Permission
This endpoint requires `Request` permission for endpoint type `UploadFile`, assigned by the accounts 
in one of the following fields (in order of precedence).

| Request parameter   | Description   |
| ------------------- | ------------- |
| `issuerId` | Assigned by an issuer permits uploads. |

This endpoint also requires the Issuer Admin to have assigned `Issuer` permission for endpoint type `UploadFile` to the issuer account(s) referenced by the request.

parameters.description: the issuer for which this value is uploaded.
parameters.name: issuerId

parameters.description: Optional header containing the selected user account ID when using IDP JWT tokens in the `Authorization` header. The authenticated key needs to have access to this account (type can be FULL, PRIMARY or SECONDARY). If this header is absent, the user account ID defaults to the access key ID. Requests that use CorTenX access tokens (instead of JWT) should not provide this header as the selected user account ID is already encoded in the token.
parameters.name: X-Trovio-UserAccountId

409.description: The request could not be processed.

post.description:
Set user metadata values.

 Batch set metadata values for any existing **user** metadata definitions (`isUser==true`).
 New values will be created, existing ones will be updated.

 The batch size cannot exceed the configured maximum (default: 100).
 If the batch size exceeds the configured maximum a validation failure occurs and the entire request is failed.

 When setting metadata values of type [MetadataValueType.FILE], ensure that the referenced
 file is uploaded prior to this call, by using the upload file endpoint "/metadata/file/{issuerId}/upload".
 Set both the uploaded file id and content hash, in order to properly set metadata for a previously uploaded file.
#### Endpoint Permission
This endpoint requires `Request` permission for endpoint type `SetUserMetadata`, assigned by the accounts 
in one of the following fields (in order of precedence).

| Request parameter   | Description   |
| ------------------- | ------------- |
| `userId` | Assigned by an account permits updates to that account's user values. |
| `values[].metadataRef` | Assigned by an issuer permits updates to any user's values for the issuer's metadata definitions. |

Any metadata references contained in the request require `Product` permission from the issuer of the metadata.

parameters.description:
user id setting the value. If metadata isUser is false, has to be the issuer, if is true, any user
 can set it for themselves.
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description: Optional header containing the selected user account ID when using IDP JWT tokens in the `Authorization` header. The authenticated key needs to have access to this account (type can be FULL, PRIMARY or SECONDARY). If this header is absent, the user account ID defaults to the access key ID. Requests that use CorTenX access tokens (instead of JWT) should not provide this header as the selected user account ID is already encoded in the token.
parameters.name: X-Trovio-UserAccountId

requestBody.description: List of metadata value entries to be set

409.description: The request could not be processed.

post.description:
Set issuer metadata values.

 Batch set issuer metadata values for existing **issuer** metadata definitions (`isUser==false`).
 New values will be created, existing ones will be updated.

 The batch size cannot exceed the configured maximum (default: 100).
 If the batch size exceeds the configured maximum a validation failure occurs and the entire request is failed.

 When setting metadata values of type [MetadataValueType.FILE], ensure that the referenced
 file is uploaded prior to this call, by using the upload file endpoint "/metadata/file/{issuerId}/upload".
 Set both the uploaded file id and content hash, in order to properly set metadata for a previously uploaded file.

parameters.description:
If specified, return only holdings that were issued (and not spent) in the matching blocks numbers.
 The parameter can be a range (eg 1234..5678) to return all holdings that were issued (and not spent)
 in the block range.
 If the parameter is a single block number, the system will replace it with the range `..=blockNumber` so the holdings
 returned are a snapshot of the holdings that were active holdings upto (and including) the given blockNumber.

 Default when not present is to return all active holdings up to the current block.
parameters.name: block

parameters.description:
If specified, return only holdings that were issued (and not spent) in the matching time range.
 The parameter can be a range (eg 20240101T000000..) to return all holdings that were issued in the timestamp range.
 If the parameter is a single timestamp, the system will replace it with the range `..timestamp` so the holdings
 returned are a snapshot of the active holdings at the timestamp.

 Default when not present is to return all active holdings up to the current time.
parameters.name: timestamp

parameters.description: Filter by index using ranges (ex: 3..7) and individual values (ex: 1,5,6). Combinations are also possible (ex: 1..5,8,12). A Not (!) logic is not accepted.
parameters.name: index

parameters.description:
Include information about underlying holdings in the result. The underlying amounts can be grouped by different
 properties:

 * `underlyingHolding`: Return individual underlying holdings.
 * `underlyingProduct`: Return total underlying amounts by product.
 * `underlyingProductItem`: Return total underlying amounts per distinct underlying product item.
 * `underlyingAttribute.<name>`: Return total amounts grouped by attribute value of the underlying product item.
 * `underlyingMetadata.<issuer>:<name>`: Return total amounts grouped by (indexed) metadata value of the underlying product item.

 If `includeUnderlying` is absent, no results for underlying holdings are returned.
 If `includeUnderlying` is present, the results are always grouped by `underlyingProduct`.
parameters.name: includeUnderlyingData

parameters.description:
Include information about underlying holdings in the result. The underlying amounts can be grouped by different
 properties:

 * `underlyingHolding`: Return individual underlying holdings.
 * `underlyingProduct`: Return total underlying amounts by product.
 * `underlyingProductItem`: Return total underlying amounts per distinct underlying product item.
 * `underlyingAttribute.<name>`: Return total amounts grouped by attribute value of the underlying product item.
 * `underlyingMetadata.<issuer>:<name>`: Return total amounts grouped by (indexed) metadata value of the underlying product item.

 If `includeUnderlying` is absent, no results for underlying holdings are returned.
 If `includeUnderlying` is present, the results are always grouped by `underlyingProduct`.
parameters.name: includeUnderlyingData

parameters.description:
'From' value start the next query from (inclusive).
 This value is returned in the `nextPage` field of the previous response.
 If not specified, the first result page is returned.
 There are two possible formats for the continuation token:
 - `block:index` in case the results are ordered by default block order
 - `maxBlock-index` in case results have a different order. The maxBlock part indicates the maximum block for
 possible results to ensure the next query is stable.
 - `index` the integer value of the first index of the requested page. Works with calls that
 aren't paged using block and index.
parameters.name: page.from

parameters.description:
Limit for number of results returned. If no limit is specified, the system will apply a default depending
 on the query. If a limit of zero is given, the query will not return any results. The query is not guaranteed
 to return up to the limit number of result entries if more are available. Whether more results are available
 is indicated by the presence of the `nextPage` field in the response.
parameters.name: page.limit

parameters.description: Set to `true` to include a total count of results that match the criteria in the response.
parameters.name: page.withCount

parameters.description:

 To sort in descending order, prefix the field name with `-`, e.g. `-assignedAmount`

List product item attribute values.
 For each of the product items that match the given criteria, all existing combinations of values of the given attribute references
 are returned. If includeBalances is set to `true`, the sum of the balances for each matching product item are returned.
 axes or includeBalances=true are required.

in one of the following fields (in order of precedence).

| `productIds` | Assigned by the issuer of the product permits all accounts for that product |
| `issuerId` | Assigned by an issuer permits all accounts for all products of the issuer |

Any metadata references contained in the request require `Product` permission from the issuer of the metadata.

get.description:
Get server status.
 Returns status details for a node in the system. This endpoint is used by load balancers to determine a node's
 status before allowing it to accept connections. Downstream integrations may use this endpoint to monitor
 reachability of the environment.

 There is no authentication or endpoint permission required for this endpoint.

500.description: Internal server error. The system is not ready for use, detailed status codes are in the response.

post.description:
Ensure access keys exist for OpenID subject IDs of a specific tenant.
 Accepts a CreateAccessKeysRequest request type.
 Queries access keys for all the provided subject IDs, generating new ones for subjects that do not have one yet.

 #### Wallet host errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [WalletHostErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectTransactionId] | Referenced transaction does not match the hash of the encoded transaction data. |
 | [IncompleteTransactionRequest] | Additional signatures are required. |
 | [IncorrectSignatureType] | The signature type is not supported for the key type. |
 | [InvalidSignature] | The signature data supplied was not a valid signature for the key type. |
 | [IncorrectSignature] | A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed). |
 | [IncorrectAccountId] | The `accountId` or `accessKeyId` provided does not match the public key. |
 | [IncorrectRequestMessage] | The request message type is invalid for this endpoint. |
 | [IncorrectSignatureOrder] | Duplicate signature. |

403.description: Access denied. The request was authenticated but the requesting account(s) do not have the required access permission.

409.description: The request could not be processed.

post.description:
Send a transaction request.
 The transaction request is validated and queued for processing. Validation errors will produce an immediate
 error response from this endpoint. Transaction responses (error or success) are returned as an asynchronous
 notification to the access keys that can operate on the account.

 #### Errors specific to the endpoint
 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [NoPossibleApprovers] | No possible approvers can be found for the initiated transaction request |
 | [IncorrectAccountId] | The `accountId` or `accessKeyId` provided does not match the public key |
 | [IncorrectSignature] | A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed)|
 | [InvalidSignature] | The signature data supplied was not a valid signature for the key type |
 | [IncorrectSignatureType] | The signature type is not supported for the key type |
 | [IncompleteTransactionRequest] | The transaction request requires additional signatures |

requestBody.description:
Valid transaction request with signature(s). To create this data, the transaction request details
 must be encoded using the Yabor binary encoding and subsequently signed.

201.description: The transaction request requires more approval signatures and has been stored as a 'pending transaction' and possible approvers have been notified.

202.description: The transaction request was valid and has been queued for processing.

208.description: The transaction request was already processed. The result returned is the result of the previous processing.

403.description: Access denied. The request was authenticated but the requesting account(s) do not have the required access permission.

409.description: The request could not be processed.

post.description:
Send a transaction request and wait for response.
 This request is executed synchronously, the response is returned after the transaction has executed.

 | [InvalidSignature] | The signature data supplied was not a valid signature for the key type |
 | [IncorrectSignatureType] | The signature type is not supported for the key type |
 | [IncompleteTransactionRequest] | The transaction request requires additional signatures |

get.description:
Save transaction proof.
 Store the proof-of-transaction for a particular transaction in the public-content and return the URL.
 The requesting user account needs to be assigned `Issuer` permission by the Issuer Admin in order to create
 files in the public content storage.
#### Endpoint Permission
This endpoint requires `Request` permission for endpoint type `SaveTransactionProof`, assigned by the accounts 
in one of the following fields (in order of precedence).

| Request parameter   | Description   |
| ------------------- | ------------- |
| *issuer admin* | Assigned by the Issuer Admin account permits access to all transactions. |
| *account* | Assigned by an account permits all transactions that involve that account. |

This endpoint also requires the Issuer Admin to have assigned `Issuer` permission for endpoint type `SaveTransactionProof` to the issuer account(s) referenced by the request.

AdjustHoldingRequest.description:
An issuer can reclaim holdings and transfer them back to the issuer.
 This invasive operation should occur rarely and therefore warrants a separate transaction type.

 The holdings being reclaimed can not be with the issuer already.

 The holdings being reclaimed must be of the issuer's products.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `AdjustHoldingRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | The list of holding IDs is empty. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [HoldingAccessDenied] | The issuer is not the holding issuer. |
 | [HoldingIsAlreadyWithIssuer] | Holding is already with the issuer, therefore not needed. |
 | [HoldingIsSpent] | A holding ID does not reference an unspent holding, it may be spent or invalid. |

AssignHoldingRequest.description:
Assign unassigned / unspent holdings to the given product items.

 Multiple holdings can be assigned to a list of product items. Holdings can be unassigned or assigned (i.e. unspent)
 holdings and can be assigned to unassigned or assigned product items.
 All holdings request are (re-)assigned to the product items in the order in which they are specified, creating
 new holdings in the specified product items.

 The `deflationMode` determines the way that the old holdings are spent. With `DontDeflate`, the holdings are re-assigned
 to the issuer. With `Deflate`, the product item is deflated. With `DeflateAndDelete`
 the product item is deflated and deleted if there are no more holdings. The default mode (if no mode is specified) is
 to `Deflate` if the product item is inflatable, and `DontDeflate` if the product item is not inflatable.

 The `inflationMode` determines the way that the new holdings are allocated. With `Inflate`, the product item is inflated.
 With `DontInflate` the new holding is selected from available issuer holdings. The default inflation mode (if no mode is specified)
 is to `DontInflate`.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `AssignHoldingRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | The list of holding IDs is empty. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InsufficientAvailableToAssign] | The list of product items is empty, or there is not enough available amount in the listed non-inflatable product items.  |
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | The requesting account is not the holding issuer. |
 | [ProductItemsMustBeSameProduct] | Referenced product items must be from the same product. |
 | [HoldingsMustBeSameProduct] | Referenced holdings must be from the same product. |
 | [ProductItemIsDeleted] | Referenced product item is deleted. |
 | [ProductItemNotFound] | Referenced product item does not exist. |
 | [DeflationModeNotAllowedForProductItem] | The deflation mode is not allowed for a product item. Ensure that [Deflate] is not selected for non-inflatable items. |
 | [InflationModeNotAllowedForProductItem] | The inflation mode is not allowed for a product item. Ensure that [Inflate] is not selected for non-inflatable items. |
 | [HoldingIsSpent] | A holding ID does not reference an unspent holding, it may be spent or invalid. |

AssignSecurityGroupsRequest.description:
Assign Security Groups to Accounts and Account Groups.
 An account assigns security groups to individual accounts and/or account groups, giving them access to the
 assigning account.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `AssignSecurityGroupsRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `assignedBy` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyOptionalList] | Optional lists in the request should be absent or `null` instead of `[]`. |
 | [EmptyRequest] | Empty list of updates, or the request contains an empty update. |
 | [MixingAddRemoveWithSet] | The request mixes the `add`/`remove` pattern with the 'set' pattern. |
 | [BothAddAndRemove] | The request removes an entity that it just added. |
 | [DuplicateAccountId] | A list of account IDs contains a duplicate entry. |
 | [DuplicateAccountGroupId] | A list of account group IDs contains a duplicate entry. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

BakeHoldingCondition.description:
Matches a baking of a specific product.

 An issuer can require a [BakeHoldingRequest] to bake into (instead of just baking). The issuer of the product being baked can restrict the products it can be baked into (in addition to the underlying products defined by that product definition).

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the baked holding.

bakeInto.description:
Optionally, the product item into which the holdings are baked.
 If specified, the request account must have a holding in this product item.

fromAccountId.description: The request account that owns the holdings to be baked.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

BakeHoldingRequest.description:
Bake an amount of holdings with attributes.

 Baked holdings are spent without being exchanged for another value.
 After baking, holdings can be imported into other systems with a trust relationship using the transaction proof.
 To create product items with underlying baked holdings, use [CreateProductItemRequest] with the `underlying` field.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `BakeHoldingRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `fromAccountId` field.

 If a product item is specified for baking into, the request account additionally requires Product permission from
 the issuer of the product item.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The from account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [ProductAccessDenied] | The issuer of the product did not grant permission for the transfer. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ValueHasTooManyDigits] | An amount in the holding selector exceeds maximum precision. |
 | [NonPositiveTransferAmount] | An amount in the holding selector is negative or zero. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InsufficientHoldings] | The holding selector yields insufficient unspent holdings. |
 | [InvalidRequest] | No amount referenced. |
 | [HoldingAccessDenied] | A selected holding is not held by the requester's account. |
 | [HoldingsMustBeSameProduct] | Referenced holdings must be from the same product. |
 | [HoldingIsEscrowed] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was already locked. |
 | [HoldingIsUnassigned] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was not assigned yet. |
 | [HoldingIsNotUnassigned] | An attempt was made to assign a holding that was already assigned. |
 | [NotMultipleOfUnitAmount] | The amount specified needs to be an integer multiple of the `unitAmount` of the product item. |
 | [QuantityOverflow] | The exact quantity computed overflows its type. |
 | [ProductItemNotFound] | The "bake into" product item is not found. |

CancelEscrowRequest.description:
Cancel an escrowed holding and return control to the holder.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CancelEscrowRequest`, assigned by either:
 - the request account in the `fromAccountId` field, if `requesterIsController` is set to `false`, or
 - the request account in the `controllerAccountId` field, if the `requesterIsController` is set to `true`.

 In addition, if `Controller` security groups are assigned by the controller account to the holding account, they need
 to grant the `Controller` permission for the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The request account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [ControllerAccessDenied] | The controller of an escrow did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EscrowNotFound] | Referenced escrow does not exist. |

 and holder account id. The selected holdings will be 'unlocked' and control returned to the holder.

 - the request account in the `fromAccountId` field, if `requesterIsController` is set to `false`, or
 - the request account in the `controllerAccountId` field, if the `requesterIsController` is set to `true`.

 #### Validation errors

CancelPendingTransactionRequest.description:
Cancel a pending transaction request.

 This transaction request is processed by the Wallet API itself and not forwarded to the mint-service. Therefore, it
 must be submitted to the [CoreWalletApi.cancelSignature] endpoint instead of the normal transaction endpoints.

 The attributes set on on the cancel request are persisted and visible to the request account and other signatories
 using the [CoreWalletApi.listPendingTransactions] and [CoreWalletApi.listPendingSignatures] endpoints.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request can be submitted by any access key that has signed the pending transaction, or any possible
 signatory of the pending transaction. Even an access key with SECONDARY access can still submit this request with only
 its signature.

 Alternatively, the transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CancelPendingTransactionRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `byAccountId` field.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The access key is not a signatory of the pending transaction and the `byAccountId` request account did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction or provider attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Wallet host errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [WalletHostErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [TransactionNotFound] | Referenced transaction does not exist. |

errorCode.description:
For sub-system `MINT`:

- `AccessTypeNotAllowed`: The access type is only allowed for account groups owned by the Issuer Admin account.
- `AccessUpdateCausingPermanentAccessLossNotAllowed`: The access update request causes permanent access loss to the target account.
- `AccessUpdateContainsDuplicateAccountKey`: The access update request contains duplicate account ids.
- `AccountGroupIsDeleted`: The selected account group has been deleted.
- `AccountGroupNotFound`: The requested account group does not exist.
- `AccountIsAlreadyMember`: The added account is already a member of the group.
- `AccountIsNotMember`: The removed account is not a member of the group.
- `AttributeNameExists`: An attempt was made to define an attribute with a name that is already defined.
- `AttributeTagExists`: An attempt was made to define an attribute with a tag that is already defined.
- `AttributeTagNotAllowed`: The attribute tag must be 0.
- `BakeIntoItemNotHeld`: The bake request account has no holdings of the destination product item.
- `BakedHoldingIsUsed`: The selected holding is already 'baked'.
- `BakedHoldingNotUnderlying`: Holding being baked is not an underlying of the destination product item.
- `ControllerAccessDenied`: The controller of an escrow did not grant permission for the escrow request.
- `DeflationModeNotAllowedForProductItem`: The requested deflation mode is not allowed for a product item. Ensure that `Deflate` is not selected for non-inflatable items.
- `EntityAlreadyUpdated`: This transaction already updated this entity.
- `EntityNotFound`: The entity/product/item was not found.
- `EnumAlreadyExists`: The enumerated value already exists.
- `EnumValueNotFound`: The enumerated value does not exist.
- `EscrowNotFound`: The combination of `escrowId`, `holderAccountId`, and `controllerAccountId` could not (any longer) be found.
- `HasProductItems`: The product cannot be deleted because it still has product items.
- `HoldingAccessDenied`: The specified holding is not owned by the requestor's account.
- `HoldingIsAlreadyWithIssuer`: An attempt was made to reassign a holding that was already with the issuer of the product.
- `HoldingIsEscrowed`: An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was already locked.
- `HoldingIsNotUnassigned`: An attempt was made to assign a holding that was already assigned.
- `HoldingIsNotWithIssuer`: The product item still has holdings with non-issuer accounts.
- `HoldingIsSpent`: A holding was referenced that has already been spent.
- `HoldingIsUnassigned`: An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was not assigned yet.
- `HoldingsMustBeSameProduct`: The `HoldingSelector` selected holdings that are not for the same product. When specifying existing holding ids in a holding selector, ensure that they are holdings of product items of the same product.
- `IncorrectIssuer`: The requesting account is not an issuer of the product or item.
- `IncorrectVersion`: An attempt was made to update an entity's attributes with an incorrect current version. Ensure that the attribute update request is based on the most recent entity version.
- `InflationModeNotAllowedForProductItem`: The requested inflation mode is not allowed for a product item. Ensure that `Inflate` is not selected for non-inflatable items.
- `InitialIndexNotAllowed`: An inflatable product item may not contain an initial index.
- `InitialIndexNotUnique`: The supplied index is invalid/not unique.
- `InsufficientAvailableToAssign`: Insufficient product items were provided to re-assign the requested holdings.
- `InsufficientHoldings`: The account has insufficient holdings to complete the transaction.
- `InternalError`: An (unexpected) internal error occurred while processing the transaction. Try again when things have stabilized.
- `InvalidAmount`: Product item requires an specific amount.
- `InvalidRequest`: The request failed validation and/or configured rules. This transaction error is an indication that upstream components failed to properly validate the request and may be penalized with velocity checks.
- `InvalidUnitAmount`: The `unitAmount` specified cannot be represented with the product's `maxDecimalPos`.
- `IssuerAccessDenied`: The system administrator did not grant 'issuer' permission for the request.
- `NotInitialized`: The system has not caught up with the block storage yet. Resend the request at a later time.
- `NotMultipleOfUnitAmount`: The amount specified needs to be an integer multiple of the configured `unitAmount`
- `PrecisionExceedsMaxDecimalPos`: The quantity specified exceeds the `maxDecimalPos` of the product.
- `ProductAccessDenied`: The issuer of the product did not grant permission for a transfer or issuance.
- `ProductCantFractionalize`: This product doesn't allow fractionalizable product items.
- `ProductCantInflate`: This product doesn't allow inflatable product items.
- `ProductCantSpendUnassigned`: Spending `Unassigned` holdings is not allowed for this product.
- `ProductIsDeleted`: This product doesn't allow any interaction as it is deleted.
- `ProductItemCantInflate`: An inflate transaction was attempted on a product item that does not allow inflation.
- `ProductItemIsDeleted`: The referenced product item is deleted.
- `ProductItemNotFound`: The referenced product item does not exist.
- `ProductItemRequiresUnderlying`: Creating a product item for this product requires a baked holding for each of the required products.
- `ProductItemsMustBeSameProduct`: When re-assigning holdings to a different Product Item, the product item must be of the same product.
- `ProductNotFound`: The referenced product does not exist.
- `QuantityOverflow`: The exact quantity computed overflows its type.
- `RequestAccessDenied`: The request was not signed by parties with sufficient access.
- `RequiresInitialAmount`: Non-inflatable product items require an initial amount.
- `SecurityGroupIsDeleted`: The selected security group has been deleted.
- `SecurityGroupNotFound`: The requested security group does not exist.
- `TransactionHasBeenProcessed`: Duplicate transaction id. A transaction with this id has already been processed.
- `UnderlyingNotAllowedForUnassigned`: Unassigned product items cannot have underlying baked holdings.
- `UnsupportedTransactionRequest`: The type of transaction request was not supported by this system.

For sub-system `API`:

- `AccessConditionFailed`: An access condition does not match.
- `AccessTokenExpired`: The access token has expired.
- `AccessTokenNotValidYet`: The access token is not valid yet.
- `AccountGroupNotFound`: The requested account group does not exist.
- `AttributeIsNotEnum`: The attribute trying to update is not an enum
- `AttributeNotAllowed`: The request contains attributes that are not allowed.
- `AttributeNotFoundByName`: An attribute was referenced, but no definition could be found.
- `AttributeNotFoundByTag`: An attribute was referenced, but no definition could be found.
- `BlockNotFound`: Request block does not exist.
- `BothAddAndRemove`: The request removes an entity that it just added (minimal encoding).
- `ControllerAccessDenied`: The controller of an escrow did not grant permission for the escrow request.
- `CriteriaNotSupported`: The criteria is not supported for a specific attribute type.
- `DisabledEnum`: The enum is disabled and cannot be used
- `DuplicateAccountGroupId`: The set of account group ids contains duplicates.
- `DuplicateAccountId`: The set of account ids contains duplicates.
- `DuplicateAttributeRule`: A [io.trovio.core.data.meta.AttributeUseData] contained more than one entry for the same attribute. Attributes can only be defined once. If multiple attribute values are required, use a list-attribute.
- `DuplicateEntry`: The request contains a duplicate set entry.
- `DuplicateEnumValueDef`: The list of enum value definitions contains a duplicate name or ordinal.
- `DuplicateGroupBy`: The list of groupings contains a duplicate field.
- `DuplicateMetadataDefinitionName`: A metadata definition with the given name, but different configuration already exists for this issuer.
- `DuplicateMetadataValue`: Duplicate value for metadata that requires unique values.
- `DuplicateRequester`: The signature list contains more than one signature (pair) for the same requester.
- `DuplicateSecurityGroupId`: The set of security group ids contains duplicates.
- `DuplicateUnderlyingProduct`: An [io.trovio.core.api.tx.CreateProductRequest] contained more than one entry for the same underlying product.
- `EmptyOptionalList`: List property should be absent instead of empty (minimal encoding).
- `EmptyRequest`: The request does not have any effect.
- `HoldingNotFound`: The requested holding id does not exist.
- `IncompleteTransactionRequest`: The transaction request requires additional signatures.
- `IncorrectAccountId`: The `accountId` or `accessKeyId` provided does not match the public key.
- `IncorrectRequestMessage`: The request message type is invalid for this endpoint.
- `IncorrectSignature`: A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed).
- `IncorrectSignatureOrder`: A signature was out of order (e.g. a SECONDARY before a PRIMARY).
- `IncorrectSignatureType`: The signature type is not supported for the key type.
- `IncorrectSystemId`: The signatures provided are not valid for this system.
- `IncorrectTransactionId`: The transaction id in the request does not match the hash of the encoded transaction data.
- `InitiatorHasHigherAccess`: The pending request was initiated by a user with higher access.
- `InvalidAccessToken`: The access token was not constructed correctly.
- `InvalidAccessTokenValidity`: The validity of the access token exceeds the configured limit.
- `InvalidAttributeRule`: A validation rule's definition (in an attribute definition) is not valid. For example, if the minimum value of an attribute is higher than the maximum value.
- `InvalidAttributeValue`: An attribute's value does not match the requirements of its definition.
- `InvalidCriteria`: The criteria are mutually exclusive and will produce no results.
- `InvalidCurrentState`: A query for current state is filtering by a state that is not a current state.
- `InvalidDecimalPrecision`: Number of digits is negative or higher than 18.
- `InvalidEnum`: The ordinal or name referenced as an enum value is not valid.
- `InvalidGroupBy`: The list of groupings contains invalid field names or groupings.
- `InvalidNameFormat`: The provided name field does not meet naming requirements.
- `InvalidNegativeIndex`: Index if specified cannot be negative.
- `InvalidParameter`: The parameter is invalid for some reason.
- `InvalidParameterValue`: A parameter value provided (e.g. in a criterion) cannot be parsed to the required type.
- `InvalidSetAttributeRequest`: Set attributes has no attributes to set or remove.
- `InvalidSignature`: The signature data supplied was not a valid signature for the key type.
- `InvalidSortCriterion`: The sort criterion could not be parsed. Sort criteria have to be formatted as `name` or `+name` (ascending) or `-name` (descending)
- `InvalidSpentState`: A query for historic state is filtering by a state that is not a historic state.
- `InvalidSumField`: The chosen field cannot be used in sum queries
- `InvalidTagNumber`: A create or update request was made for an invalid tag number.
- `InvalidValue`: Field value is invalid.
- `InvalidValueCriterion`: The value criterion expression could not be parsed.
- `InvalidYaborEncoding`: Invalid Yabor encoding encountered.
- `IssuerAccessDenied`: The system administrator did not grant 'issuer' permission for the request.
- `IssuerMetadataCannotBeSet`: Issuer specific metadata values cannot be set in user-metadata context.
- `LimitTooLow`: The result limit for the given query is too low to be able to respond to this request.
- `ListExceedsLimit`: The number of items in a list exceeds the configured limit.
- `MetadataDefinitionIssuerIdDoesNotMatchProvided`: Existing metadata issuer does not match provided issuer ID.
- `MetadataDefinitionNotFound`: Metadata with the given identifier does not exist, or cannot be accessed by the current user.
- `MetadataEmptyValue`: The metadata value is empty.
- `MetadataEntityReferenceDoesNotMatchDefinition`: Metadata entity reference provided does not match metadata definition entity reference type.
- `MetadataEntryNotFound`: Metadata value entry could not be found.
- `MetadataFileDownloadFailed`: Metadata file download has failed.
- `MetadataFileProvidedHashDoesNotMatchComputed`: Provided hash does not match computed value.
- `MetadataFileSizeExceedsLimit`: The metadata file size exceeds the limit.
- `MetadataFileUploadFailed`: Metadata file upload has failed.
- `MetadataInvalidFileName`: The metadata file name is invalid.
- `MetadataJsonValueNotValid`: The JSON provided is invalid.
- `MetadataJsonValueTooLong`: The metadata JSON value provided is too long.
- `MetadataMissingUploadedFileIdentifier`: Metadata uploaded file identifier missing.
- `MetadataReferenceIsInvalid`: Metadata reference is invalid.
- `MetadataReferenceListExceedsLimit`: Number of provided metadata references exceeds limit.
- `MetadataReferencedEntityNotFound`: The referenced entity was not found.
- `MetadataTypeIndexingNotSupported`: Indexing is not available for this metadata value type.
- `MetadataValueTypeDoesNotMatchDefinition`: Metadata value is of different type than the metadata definition it references.
- `MinCountLargerThanMaxCountValue`: The minCount value cannot be larger than the maxCount value.
- `MissingAttributeRequired`: The request is missing a required attribute.
- `MixingAddRemoveWithSet`: The request mixes the add/remove pattern with the 'set' pattern.
- `NegativeInitialAmount`: The initial amount cannot be negative.
- `NoAccountAccess`: The access key has no access to the requested account.
- `NoPossibleApprovers`: No possible approvers can be found for the initiated transaction request.
- `NonPositiveTransferAmount`: The transfer amount cannot be negative or zero.
- `NonPositiveUnitAmount`: The unit amount cannot be negative or zero.
- `NotAListAttribute`: The referenced attribute is not a list.
- `NotFound`: An entity was not found.
- `NotInitialized`: The system has not been initialized yet.
- `NotSameHierarchy`: The conditions in the permission statement are for different context hierarchies, the statement can never match.
- `NotificationAccessDenied`: No permission to access this notification topic.
- `PendingRequestSuperseded`: There is already a pending request for this transaction that has progressed further.
- `ProductAccessDenied`: The issuer of the product did not grant permission for a transfer or issuance.
- `ProductItemNotFound`: No product item matches the requested product item id.
- `ProductNotFound`: No product matches the requested product id.
- `QueryTooBroad`: Additional criteria need to be applied to this query, as the result set would be too large.
- `RequestAccessDenied`: The request was not signed by parties with sufficient access.
- `RequestAccountDoesNotMatch`: The referenced request account is not the actual request account.
- `ResponseTimeout`: The endpoint did not receive a transaction response within the configured time.
- `SecurityGroupNotFound`: The requested security group does not exist.
- `SortingByListAttributeUnsupported`: Sorting by a list type attribute is not supported
- `StringContainsInvalidCharacter`: The provided input contains non-printable Unicode characters or non-Unicode characters.
- `StringLengthExceedsMaximum`: The provided input exceeds the maximum allowed string length.
- `SystemAccessDenied`: No access allowed for this user account.
- `SystemAccessSuspended`: The system state does not allow this access at the moment.
- `TooManyEntriesPerRequest`: Number of allowed entries for a batched operation has been exceeded.
- `TooManyRequests`: Too many concurrent requests. Back off and try again later.
- `TransactionNotFound`: The request transaction `block:index` was not found.
- `TransactionTypeNotAllowed`: The request type is not allowed.
- `UnexpectedMessageType`: The message received was not the expected type.
- `UnsupportedAttributeType`: The specified attribute type is not supported by this request.
- `UnsupportedDeflationMode`: The specified deflation mode is not supported by this request type.
- `UnsupportedField`: Sort was requested for a field that does not support sorting or was not grouped by.
- `UnsupportedMetadataEntityReferenceType`: Provided metadata entity reference type is not allowed.
- `UnsupportedSignatureVersion`: A signature was presented that has a version that is not supported by this implementation.
- `UpdateEnumNotAllowed`: The account id is not allowed to update the enum
- `UserMetadataCannotBeIndexed`: User specific metadata cannot be indexed.
- `UserMetadataCannotBePublic`: User specific metadata cannot be public.
- `UserMetadataCannotBeSet`: User specific metadata values cannot be set in issuer-metadata context.
- `UserNotFound`: The user identified by the authorization token was not found. First invoke the `getUserAccountData` endpoint to ensure user data is available.
- `ValueHasTooManyDigits`: Provided value has too many digits to be successfully persisted.

For sub-system `WALLET`:

- `AccessKeyIdIncorrectForSignatureRequest`: The provided access key id does not match the authenticated user's account id.
- `AccountNotFound`: Request specified unknown account.
- `CancelRequestAccessDenied`: Account does not have the authority to cancel pending request.
- `IdentityProviderUnknown`: Identity provider does not exist.
- `IdentityProviderVersionInvalid`: Identity provider request version does not match repository version.
- `IdentityProviderWithMatchingIssuerUriExists`: An identity provider with this issuer URI already exists.
- `IdentitySubjectIdInvalid`: The provided identity subject ID was invalid.
- `IdentityTenantAlreadyDeleted`: The identity tenant is already deleted.
- `IdentityTenantVersionInvalid`: Identity tenant request version does not match repository version.
- `IncorrectEndpoint`: The signed request was sent to the incorrect endpoint.
- `InternalError`: An internal error occurred during execution.
- `InvalidStartTime`: Start time was before the current time.
- `PendingTransactionNotFound`: The pending transaction being cancelled or deleted does not exist.
- `PendingTransactionRequestRejected`: Transaction was rejected by a signatory while in the pending transaction queue.
- `SaveTransactionProofDisabled`: The save transaction proof to public content functionality is disabled.
- `TenantIdUnknown`: Request specified unknown tenant ID.
- `TenantOwnerIncorrect`: The provided tenant owner is incorrect.
- `TenantUsersOrProvidersNotEmpty`: The tenant cannot be deleted because users and/or identity providers are associated with it.
- `TokenIssuerUnknown`: The provided token was issued by an unknown identity provider.
- `TransactionAlreadyProcessed`: The wallet transaction request was already processed.

For sub-system `BLOCK`:

- `AccessKeyNotFound`: An access key was referenced that was not found.
- `BlockAlreadyInStorage`: The block persist operation was called for a block number that is already in block storage.
- `BlockNotFound`: Required block does not exist.
- `CertificateCanNotBeVerified`: The conductor certificate could not be verified.
- `CertificateNotFound`: A key was referenced for which the certificate could not be found.
- `IncorrectBlockHash`: The previous block hash does not match the next block's header.
- `IncorrectBodyHash`: The proof's computed body hash does not match the block header.
- `IncorrectKeyId`: The `keyId` does not match the public key
- `IncorrectPublicKeyId`: When verifying a signature, the id of the public key supplied did not match the id supplied with the signature data.
- `IncorrectRequestSignatureHash`: The hash of the request signatures does not match the provided request signature hash bytes.
- `IncorrectSignature`: A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed)
- `IncorrectSignatureType`: The signature type is not supported for the key type.
- `IncorrectTransactionHash`: The proof details do not match the provided transaction hash.
- `IncorrectTransactionId`: The request details do not match the transaction id.
- `InvalidCertificate`: The certificate could not be parsed.
- `InvalidSignature`: The signature data supplied was not a valid signature for the key type.
- `InvalidTransactionHashes`: The transaction hashes in the block footer do not match the actual transaction hashes.
- `TransactionIndexOutOfRange`: The proof does not contain sufficient merkle nodes for the given transaction index.
- `TrustAnchorNotFound`: The proof did not contain a public key for a referenced trust anchor.

For sub-system `METADATA`:

- `MetadataFileDownloadFailed`: Metadata of type file download failed
- `OperationFailed`: Generic operation failed, used when reason of failure is unknown

message.description:
Optionally, an additional error message. The message property will not be populated in production systems
 if the status is `400` (Bad Request) or `403` (Forbidden).

subSystem.description:
The subsystem indicates the error code enum used for the `errorCode` field.
 - `API`: API invocation error
 - `MINT`: Transaction processing error
 - `WALLET`: Wallet function error
 - `BLOCK`: Block consistency error
 - `METADATA`: Metadata processing error

CoreNotification.description:
Notification body. Each notification type has a corresponding notification data class.
The `type` field specifies the notification type and determines the fields of the notification.

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the request.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

owner.description: The owner of the tenant where the access keys are created.

subClaims.description: The list of subjects for which to create access keys.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID for the access keys.

CreateAccessKeysRequest.description:
Request object for creating access keys.
 A request can set up access keys for up to 100 subjects within a single tenant.

 This transaction request is processed by the Tenant API itself and not forwarded to the mint-service. Therefore, it
 must be submitted to the [CoreTenantApi.identityProviderConfigRequest] endpoint instead of the normal transaction endpoints.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CreateAccessKeysRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `owner` field.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `owner` account did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction or provider attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Wallet host errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [WalletHostErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [TooManyEntriesPerRequest] | A maximum of 100 subject claims (subClaims) can be processed in one transaction. |
 | [TenantIdUnknown] | Tenant does not exist. |
 | [TenantOwnerIncorrect] | The referenced owner is not the owner of the referenced tenant. |

accessType.description:
When set, the access type for the new account group. The owner can set any access type,
 except [UserAccessType.OperatorAccess] which can only be set if the owner of the group
 is the Issuer Admin account.

accountIds.description: Initial list of accounts to add to this group.

attributes.description: Transaction attributes.

isVisibleToMembers.description: If true, this account group can be returned in a `ListVisibleAccountGroups` request.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

ownerId.description: Issuer that becomes the owner of the account group.

visibleToMembersOf.description:
Update the 'visible to members of' account group.
 There is only one 'visible to members of' account group, so the list can only contain 0 or 1 entries.

CreateAccountGroupRequest.description:
Create a new account group.
 The account group will receive a block:index identifier in the response.
 An initial list of accounts can be added upon creation.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CreateAccountGroupRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `ownerId` field.

 In addition, the Issuer Admin account must have assigned `Issuer` permission to the `ownerId` account for the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `ownerId` account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [IssuerAccessDenied] | The Issuer administrator did not grant `Issuer` permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [DuplicateAccountId] | The list of `accountIds` contains duplicates. |
 | [ListExceedsLimit] | The `visibleToMembersOf` list is limited to a single account group ID. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [AccountGroupIsDeleted] | The account group referenced in `visibleToMembersOf` has been deleted. |

txId.description: Informational transaction id, the transaction id is actually the hash of the request.

attributes.description: Extra attributes for the order.

controllerAccountId.description: Controller that can unlock the escrow.

fromAccountId.description: Account requesting the offering of its holders.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

CreateEscrowRequest.description:
We can probably come up with a more generic name for this request, but essentially it locks holdings to an
 escrow controller. The (remainder of) these holdings can be cancelled by both the from account and/or the controller.
 The controller can 'trade' these holdings against other holdings in an atomic transaction.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CreateEscrowRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `fromAccountId` field.

 In addition, if `Controller` security groups are assigned by the controller account to the request account, they need
 to grant the `Controller` permission for the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The request account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [ControllerAccessDenied] | The prospective controller did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ValueHasTooManyDigits] | An amount in the holding selector exceeds maximum precision. |
 | [NonPositiveTransferAmount] | An amount in the holding selector is negative or zero. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InsufficientHoldings] | The holding selector did not select any holdings. |
 | [QuantityOverflow] | The exact quantity computed overflows its type. |
 | [HoldingAccessDenied] | The specified holding is not owned by the requestor's account |
 | [HoldingsMustBeSameProduct] | Referenced holdings must be from the same product |
 | [HoldingIsEscrowed] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was already locked |
 | [HoldingIsUnassigned] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was not assigned yet |
 | [HoldingIsNotUnassigned] | An attempt was made to assign a holding that was already assigned |
 | [NotMultipleOfUnitAmount] | The amount must be an integer multiple of the `unitAmount` of the product item. |

account.description:
Tenant owner account. The account field here has to be the owner of the tenant referenced in this same request.
 It is also the account that has to be the requesting account, as only the tenant owner can effect changes within the tenant.

additionalApplicationIds.description: Additional application IDs (used to set more than one applicationId)

applicationId.description: Application ID (the aud claim of the access token will be validated against this value, an empty value will disable this validation).

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the request.

enabled.description: Enable or not this identity provider (not effective if the issuerUri is used in other identity providers and aud claim validation is disabled).

identityProviderAttributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the identity provider.

issuerUri.description: Issuer URI (must provide an openid discovery endpoint).

migrateFromSubjectIdClaim.description:
Name of the claim the Identity Provider is migrating from when updating the [subjectIdClaim].
 When updating the [subjectIdClaim], a migration from the previous or default [subjectIdClaim] might be needed
 if there are already users authenticating with this Identity Provider.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

responseType.description: Authentication flow response type. One of or combination of: id_token, none, code, token (except none, values can be combined). See https://openid.net/specs/oauth-v2-multiple-response-types-1_0.html#OAuthResponseTypesReg

subjectIdClaim.description: Name of the claim used by the identity provider token to identity a user. If none is set, the default will be "sub".

tenantId.description: Internal tenant id (used as the main key in grouping users under a tenant).

visible.description: Control the visibility of this identity provider via the configuration endpoint. Setting an identity provider to visible=false does not disable it. Defaults to "true".

CreateIdentityProviderRequest.description:
Tenant owner creates a new identity provider.

 This transaction request is processed by the Tenant API itself and not forwarded to the mint-service. Therefore, it
 must be submitted to the [CoreTenantApi.identityProviderConfigRequest] endpoint instead of the normal transaction endpoints.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CreateIdentityProviderRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `account` field.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `account` account did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction or provider attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction or provider attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction or provider attribute was not defined. |

 #### Wallet host errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [WalletHostErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [TenantOwnerIncorrect] | The referenced tenant owner is not the owner of the referenced tenant  |
 | [TenantIdUnknown] | Referenced tenant does not exist  |
 | [IdentityProviderWithMatchingIssuerUriExists] | An identity provider with this issuer URI already exists. |

account.description: Account who will own this tenant. This account will be the only one who can effect changes within this tenant.

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the request.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

tenantAttributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the tenant.

tenantDisplayName.description: A display name for this tenant.

CreateIdentityTenantRequest.description:
Create a new identity tenant.

 This transaction request is processed by the Tenant API itself and not forwarded to the mint-service. Therefore, it
 must be submitted to the [CoreTenantApi.identityTenantConfigRequest] endpoint instead of the normal transaction endpoints.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CreateIdentityTenantRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `account` field.

 In addition, the Issuer Administrator account must have assigned `Issuer` permission to the `account` account for the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `account` account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [IssuerAccessDenied] | The Issuer administrator did not grant `Issuer` permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction or tenant attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction or tenant attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction or tenant attribute was not defined. |

 #### Wallet host errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [WalletHostErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|

defs.description: List of metadata definitions to be created

issuerId.description: Owner of metadata definitions to be created

attributes.description: Initial attributes (the issuer may change attributes using the SetAttributeRequest).

Initial quantity (in product units) of this item. If the product item cannot inflate, this quantity cannot
 be changed.

initialIndex.description: When presented, the product item will start indices at the given initial index, in quantity units.

isUnassigned.description: Is the an 'unassigned' product item that still needs to be assigned to a backed item.

toAccountId.description: Set an accountId to assign the new productItem initialAmount to.

underlying.description:
