unitAmount.description: Amount of product in each quantity unit.

CreateProductItemRequest.description:
Create a new Product Item with initial holdings.

 The product item is created for the product owned by the issuer.
 The attributes in this request are the (initial) Product Item attributes, and have to satisfy the attribute rules
 configured in the Product.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CreateProductItemRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 If a `toAccountId` is specified, that account needs to be assigned `Product` permission by the product's issuer for
 the request.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ValueHasTooManyDigits] | An amount in the holding selector exceeds maximum precision. |
 | [NonPositiveTransferAmount] | An amount in the holding selector is negative or zero. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [NegativeInitialAmount] | The `initialAmount` cannot be negative. |
 | [NonPositiveUnitAmount] | The `unitAmount` cannot be negative or zero. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ProductIsDeleted] | Referenced product is deleted |
 | [ProductNotFound] | Referenced product not found |
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | The account in `issuerId` is not issuer of the referenced product. |
 | [ProductCantInflate] | Referenced product doesn't allow inflatable product items. |
 | [ProductCantFractionalize] | Referenced product doesn't allow fractionalizable product items. |
 | [InvalidUnitAmount] | The `unitAmount` specified cannot be represented with the product's `maxDecimalPos`. |
 | [RequiresInitialAmount] | Non-inflatable product items require an initial amount. |
 | [InitialIndexNotAllowed] | An inflatable product item cannot contain an initial index. |
 | [UnderlyingNotAllowedForUnassigned] | Unassigned product items cannot have underlying baked holdings. |
 | [ProductItemRequiresUnderlying] | Creating a product item for this product requires a baked holding for each of the required products. |
 | [InitialIndexNotUnique] | Initial index is less than next possible index. |
 | [MissingAttributeRequired] | Missing required attribute. |
 | [AttributeNotAllowed] | The request contains a forbidden attribute. |
 | [InvalidAttributeRule] | A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed)|
 | [InvalidEnum] | The ordinal or name referenced as an enum value is not valid. |
 | [DisabledEnum] | The referenced enum value is disabled. |

assignAfterSeconds.description: Number of seconds to wait before auto-assigning.

assignIfAvailable.description: Automatically assign product items when they are/become available?

attributes.description: Additional attributes for this product.

canInflate.description: Can normal product items allow inflation/deflation? 'Unassigned' product items can always allow inflation.

canSpendUnassigned.description: Can unassigned holdings be already spent?

code.description:
Immutable short 'currency' code for this product. Maybe later we'll add a meta-data attribute to override,
 but alternatively all holdings could be moved to a new product if required and the 'old' product retired.

fixedQuantity.description: Each product item will require this exact quantity.

hasUniqueIndices.description:
If true, ensure that product item indices are unique across the whole product. If no initialIndex is given for a
 product item, the system will assign the next available starting index. If false, each product item can have an
 arbitrary starting index (or zero).

issuerId.description: Issuer account that is creating the product.

itemAttributes.description: Allowed / required attributes for product items.

maxDecimalPos.description: Maximum number of decimal digits to track for quantities of this product.

minDecimalPos.description: Minimum number of decimal digits to show for quantities of this product.

name.description:
Internal 'default' name for this product. Other (internationalized) names can be attached to the product
 using metadata.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

underlying.description: List of product ids for which holdings must be baked for each (assignable) product item.

CreateProductRequest.description:
Issuer creates a new product.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `CreateProductRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 In addition, the Issuer Administrator account must have assigned `Issuer` permission to the `issuerId` account for the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `issuerId` account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [IssuerAccessDenied] | The Issuer administrator did not grant `Issuer` permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidDecimalPrecision] | Decimal position has to be between 0 and 18 |
 | [DuplicateUnderlyingProduct] | Duplicated underlying product |
 | [DuplicateAttributeRule] | Duplicated attribute |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ProductCantInflate] | Product cannot inflate if it has a fixed quantity. |
 | [PrecisionExceedsMaxDecimalPos] | Fixed quantity has a higher precision than the maximum allowed. |

 #### Validation errors

 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | A permission statement has an empty conditions list, or one of the conditions has an empty set. |
 | [DuplicateEntry] | A permission statement has a condition with a list that contains duplicates. |
 | [NotSameHierarchy] | A permission statement combines conditions from different context hierarchies. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request is not expected to fail.

DefineAttributeRequest.description:
Request to define an attribute.

 Previously, the system allowed requests to set the tag number for the attribute, this is no longer the case.
 From now on, the tag number in the attribute definition data must be zero and the system will automatically assign
 the next available tag number to the attribute definition.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DefineAttributeRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `definition.createdBy` field.

 In addition, the Issuer Administrator account must have assigned `Issuer` permission to the `definition.createdBy` account for the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `definition.createdBy` account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [IssuerAccessDenied] | The Issuer administrator did not grant `Issuer` permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeRule] | A rule defined for the new attribute is not valid. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [AttributeNameExists] | Attribute name already exists. |
 | [InvalidTagNumber] | Attribute tag number has to be zero. |

DeflateProductItemRequest.description:
Deflate product item.
 An inflatable Product Item can be 'deflated', i.e. the total supply of the item can be decreased.
 The selected holdings must be held by the issuer to allow them to be deflated.
 To deflate holdings not held by the issuer, Transfer (from the non-issuer account) or Adjust (to force them to be
 re-assigned to the issuer) the holdings first.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DeflateProductItemRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ValueHasTooManyDigits] | An amount in the holding selector exceeds maximum precision. |
 | [NonPositiveTransferAmount] | An amount in the holding selector is negative or zero. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InsufficientHoldings] | Insufficient amount to transfer. |
 | [QuantityOverflow] | The exact quantity computed overflows its type. |
 | [HoldingAccessDenied] | A specified holding is not held by the issuer. |
 | [HoldingsMustBeSameProduct] | Referenced holdings must be from the same product. |
 | [HoldingIsEscrowed] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was already locked. |
 | [HoldingIsUnassigned] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was not assigned yet. |
 | [NotMultipleOfUnitAmount] | The amount specified needs to be an integer multiple of the configured `unitAmount` |

DeleteAccountGroupsRequest.description:
Delete account group(s).

 The account group will be marked as deleted and can no longer be used.
 Multiple account groups can be deleted at the same time.
 Any security group assignments to the account group are removed.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DeleteAccountGroupsRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `ownerId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | Empty list of updates, or the request contains an empty update. |
 | [DuplicateAccountGroupId] | A list of account group IDs contains a duplicate entry. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | An account group being deleted is not owner by the `ownerId` account. |
 | [IncorrectVersion] | An account group version was specified that was not the latest version of that account group. |
 | [AccountGroupNotFound] | Referenced account group does not exist. |
 | [AccountGroupIsDeleted] | Referenced account group has been deleted. |

DeleteIdentityProviderRequest.description:
Tenant owner deletes an identity provider.

 This transaction request is processed by the Tenant API itself and not forwarded to the mint-service. Therefore, it
 must be submitted to the [CoreTenantApi.identityProviderConfigRequest] endpoint instead of the normal transaction endpoints.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DeleteIdentityProviderRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `account` field.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `account` account did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction or provider attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Wallet host errors

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [TenantOwnerIncorrect] | The referenced tenant owner is not the owner of the referenced tenant  |
 | [TenantIdUnknown] | Referenced tenant does not exist  |
 | [IdentityProviderVersionInvalid] | Identity provider request version does not match repository version |
 | [IdentityProviderUnknown] | Identity provider does not exist |

DeletePendingTransactionRequest.description:
Delete a cancelled pending transaction request.

 This transaction request is processed by the Wallet API itself and not forwarded to the mint-service. Therefore, it
 must be submitted to the [CoreWalletApi.deletePendingTx] endpoint instead of the normal transaction endpoints.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request can be submitted by any access key that has signed the pending transaction, or any possible
 signatory of the pending transaction. Even an access key with SECONDARY access can still submit this request with only
 its signature.

 Alternatively, the transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DeletePendingTransactionRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `byAccountId` field.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The access key is not a signatory of the pending transaction and the `byAccountId` request account did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction or provider attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Wallet host errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [WalletHostErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [NotFound] | Referenced transaction does not exist. |
 | [TransactionNotFound] | Referenced transaction does not exist. |

deflationMode.description: Determines how the given holdings are re-assigned. Defaults to DontDeflate.

DeleteProductItemRequest.description:
Delete Product Item.

 When all holdings of a Product Item are held by the issuer, the product item can be deleted (and holdings deflated).
 To force all holdings to be deleted, even though they may be held by non-issuer accounts, specify a `deflationMode`
 of [DeflationMode.DeflateAndDelete].

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DeleteProductItemRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [UnsupportedDeflationMode] | `deflationMode` can only be null, [DeflationMode.DontDeflate], or [DeflationMode.DeflateAndDelete]. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | The `issuerId` request account is not the issuer of the product. |
 | [ProductItemIsDeleted] | Referenced product item is already deleted. |
 | [ProductItemNotFound] | Referenced product item does not exist. |
 | [HoldingIsEscrowed] | The product item cannot be deleted because some of its holdings are escrowed. |
 | [HoldingIsNotWithIssuer] | The product item cannot be deleted because not all holdings are with the issuer, and `deflationMode` is not `DeflateAndDelete`. |

DeleteProductRequest.description:
Delete Product.

 When a Product has no more product items, it can be deleted.
 Deletion marks the product as 'deleted'. Historical queries can still reference the product but it will no longer
 be returned in the queries (unless `includeDeleted` is selected).

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DeleteProductRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 | [IncorrectIssuer] | The `issuerId` request account is not the issuer of the product. |
 | [ProductIsDeleted] | Referenced product is already deleted  |
 | [ProductNotFound] | Referenced product does not exist. |

DocumentData.description: Temporary class that embeds document data in a transaction.

EndpointTypeCondition.description: Access condition that matches on the request transaction type.

id.description: Reference to the original entity (block and index where it was created)

type.description: The type of entity that is referenced by the id.

EntityRefCondition.description:
Condition that tests if entities being operated on are part of a set of allowed entities.
 The entities being validated differ depending on the request type:
 * [AssignHoldingRequest] - `productItems`
 * [AssignHoldingSelectorRequest] - `productItems`
 * [CreateProductRequest] - `productId`
 * [AssignSecurityGroupsRequest] - `updates.setSecurityGroupIds + updates.addSecurityGroupIds + updates.remoteSecurityGroupIds + updates.accountGroupIds`
 * [CreateProductItemRequest] - `productId`
 * [DeleteAccountGroupsRequest] - `groups.accountGroupId`
 * [DeleteProductItemRequest] - `productItemId`
 * [DeleteProductRequest] - `productId`
 * [DeleteSecurityGroupsRequest] - `entries.securityGroupId`
 * [InflateProductItemRequest] - `productItemId`
 * [SetAttributeRequest] - `entity` (generic entity reference)
 * [SetMultiAttributeRequest] - `entities.ids` (generic entity references)
 * [UpdateAccountGroupsRequest] - `updates.accountGroupId`
 * [UpdateSecurityGroupsRequest] - `entries.securityGroupId`

Request for a specific amount of a particular product in escrow from a specific account.
 The requesting account needs to be the controller of the escrowed holding.

Notifies a controller that an ordered was cancelled by the holder account.
 (Or notifies the holder account that the controller cancelled an order)

EscrowReceivedNotification.description: Notifies an account that it became the controller of a new escrow order.

attributes.description: Attributes from original CreateEscrowRequest.

HoldingAdjustedNotification.description: Notifies accounts that holdings were adjusted by the issuer.

amount.description: Amount to select holdings for (null for all).

inputList.description:
Holdings to select. If an amount is specified, the amount will be selected from these holdings
 in the order they are presented. If no amount is specified, the full holdings will be selected.

HoldingAmount.description: Select an amount from a specific set of holdings (holdings must be same product).

amount.description: Amount to select holdings for (null for all).

inputList.description:
Holdings to select. If an amount is specified, the amount will be selected from these holdings
 in the order they are presented. If no amount is specified, the full holdings will be selected.

holdings.description: Each entry selects an amount from a list of holdings.

HoldingAmounts.description: Select specific amounts from multiple holdings (of the same product).

HoldingAssignedNotification.description: Notifies accounts that holdings were assigned to (new) product items.

bakedAttributes.description: Final attributes when holding was baked.

bakedIntoProductItem.description: Product item that this holding was baked into.

bakedIntoProductItemId.description: Product item id that this holding was baked into.

controllerAccountId.description: If escrowed, the controller of the escrow.

escrowId.description: If escrowed, the unique id of the escrow.

index.description: Start index in the product item (for non-inflatable items)

issuedIn.description: Hash of the transaction that issued this holding

issuedInTransaction.description: Block and index of the transaction that issued this holding.

issuedTime.description: Timestamp of the transaction that issued the holding

issuer.description: Issuer data (present if issuer data is requested).

issuerId.description: Issuer id for this product (present if issuer data is not included)

metadata.description: Metadata that was queried for the holding (entity references: [MetadataEntityRefType.BAKED_HOLDING]).

product.description: Product data (present if product data is requested).

productItem.description: Product item data (present if product item data is requested).

spentInTransaction.description: Block and index of the transaction that issued this holding.

spentTime.description: Timestamp of the transaction that issued the holding

holdings.description: Each entry selects a specific starting index and quantity from a list of holdings.

HoldingQuantity.description:
Select specific index (i.e. serial number) ranges from multiple holdings (of the same product),
 i.e. which specific parts of the holdings are to be transacted.
 If multiple entries reference the same holding id, they must be disjunct.

holdingId.description: Holding to select from. The holding must be held by the from/request account.

index.description:
Start index in the holding's product item to select.
 The index must be greater than or equal to the holding's index and less than the holding's index+quantity.
 If absent, the first index of the holding will be selected.

quantity.description:
Quantity of the holding to select. The request index + quantity must not exceed the holding's index + quantity.
 If no quantity is given, the remainder of the holding is selected.

migrateFromSubjectIdClaim.description:
Name of the claim the Identity Provider is migrating from when updating the [subjectIdClaim].
 When updating the [subjectIdClaim], a migration from the previous or default [subjectIdClaim] might be needed
 if there are already users authenticating with this Identity Provider.

subjectId.description:
Unique user identitier within the tenant.
 By default, this value is the 'sub' claim from the user's token.
 Different configured providers can use different claims to identify the user,
 as long as those claims contain the same ID value for the same user.

amount.description: Amount of product in each quantity unit.

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the transaction.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

toAccountId.description: Account to receive the inflated holding.

InflateProductItemRequest.description:
Inflate Product Item.
 Creates a new holding in the given Product Item and assigns it to the given account. This will inflate the supply
 of the Product. Only inflatable Product Items may be inflated.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DeleteSecurityGroupsRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 The `toAccountId` needs to be assigned `Product` permission by the product's issuer for the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `issuerId` account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [ProductAccessDenied] | The issuer of the product did not grant `Product` permission to the `toAccountId`. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ValueHasTooManyDigits] | An amount in the holding selector exceeds maximum precision. |
 | [NonPositiveTransferAmount] | An amount in the holding selector is negative or zero. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | Requester is not the issuer of the product. |
 | [ProductItemIsDeleted] | Referenced product item is deleted. |
 | [ProductItemNotFound] | Referenced product item does not exist. |
 | [ProductItemCantInflate] | Product item does not allow inflation. |
 | [NotMultipleOfUnitAmount] | The amount specified needs to be an integer multiple of the `unitAmount` of the product item. |
 | [QuantityOverflow] | The exact quantity computed overflows its type. |

Indicates whether values stored in metadata entries of this definition will be indexed or not.
 Indexed values can be queried and used to query entities which are mapped by metadata entries.

Indicates whether metadata entries of this definition will be publicly accessible
 (without requiring authentication or authorization)

isUser.description:
Indicates whether the metadata definition and metadata entries of this definition are only accessible by the
 user that has defined and set them, via the metadata user endpoints.

A map of metadata for entities that are referenced in a response.
 The metadata for the response entries themselves will be in the `metadata` field of the respective `*Data` clasess,
 but any other metadata that is requested in the response will be available in this map.

errorCode.description:
- `AccessTypeNotAllowed`: The access type is only allowed for account groups owned by the Issuer Admin account.
- `AccessUpdateCausingPermanentAccessLossNotAllowed`: The access update request causes permanent access loss to the target account.
- `AccessUpdateContainsDuplicateAccountKey`: The access update request contains duplicate account ids.
- `AccountGroupIsDeleted`: The selected account group has been deleted.
- `AccountGroupNotFound`: The requested account group does not exist.
- `AccountIsAlreadyMember`: The added account is already a member of the group.
- `AccountIsNotMember`: The removed account is not a member of the group.
- `AttributeNameExists`: An attempt was made to define an attribute with a name that is already defined.
- `AttributeTagExists`: An attempt was made to define an attribute with a tag that is already defined.
- `AttributeTagNotAllowed`: The attribute tag must be 0.
- `BakeIntoItemNotHeld`: The bake request account has no holdings of the destination product item.
- `BakedHoldingIsUsed`: The selected holding is already 'baked'.
- `BakedHoldingNotUnderlying`: Holding being baked is not an underlying of the destination product item.
- `ControllerAccessDenied`: The controller of an escrow did not grant permission for the escrow request.
- `DeflationModeNotAllowedForProductItem`: The requested deflation mode is not allowed for a product item. Ensure that `Deflate` is not selected for non-inflatable items.
- `EntityAlreadyUpdated`: This transaction already updated this entity.
- `EntityNotFound`: The entity/product/item was not found.
- `EnumAlreadyExists`: The enumerated value already exists.
- `EnumValueNotFound`: The enumerated value does not exist.
- `EscrowNotFound`: The combination of `escrowId`, `holderAccountId`, and `controllerAccountId` could not (any longer) be found.
- `HasProductItems`: The product cannot be deleted because it still has product items.
- `HoldingAccessDenied`: The specified holding is not owned by the requestor's account.
- `HoldingIsAlreadyWithIssuer`: An attempt was made to reassign a holding that was already with the issuer of the product.
- `HoldingIsEscrowed`: An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was already locked.
- `HoldingIsNotUnassigned`: An attempt was made to assign a holding that was already assigned.
- `HoldingIsNotWithIssuer`: The product item still has holdings with non-issuer accounts.
- `HoldingIsSpent`: A holding was referenced that has already been spent.
- `HoldingIsUnassigned`: An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was not assigned yet.
- `HoldingsMustBeSameProduct`: The `HoldingSelector` selected holdings that are not for the same product. When specifying existing holding ids in a holding selector, ensure that they are holdings of product items of the same product.
- `IncorrectIssuer`: The requesting account is not an issuer of the product or item.
- `IncorrectVersion`: An attempt was made to update an entity's attributes with an incorrect current version. Ensure that the attribute update request is based on the most recent entity version.
- `InflationModeNotAllowedForProductItem`: The requested inflation mode is not allowed for a product item. Ensure that `Inflate` is not selected for non-inflatable items.
- `InitialIndexNotAllowed`: An inflatable product item may not contain an initial index.
- `InitialIndexNotUnique`: The supplied index is invalid/not unique.
- `InsufficientAvailableToAssign`: Insufficient product items were provided to re-assign the requested holdings.
- `InsufficientHoldings`: The account has insufficient holdings to complete the transaction.
- `InternalError`: An (unexpected) internal error occurred while processing the transaction. Try again when things have stabilized.
- `InvalidAmount`: Product item requires an specific amount.
- `InvalidRequest`: The request failed validation and/or configured rules. This transaction error is an indication that upstream components failed to properly validate the request and may be penalized with velocity checks.
- `InvalidUnitAmount`: The `unitAmount` specified cannot be represented with the product's `maxDecimalPos`.
- `IssuerAccessDenied`: The system administrator did not grant 'issuer' permission for the request.
- `NotInitialized`: The system has not caught up with the block storage yet. Resend the request at a later time.
- `NotMultipleOfUnitAmount`: The amount specified needs to be an integer multiple of the configured `unitAmount`
- `PrecisionExceedsMaxDecimalPos`: The quantity specified exceeds the `maxDecimalPos` of the product.
- `ProductAccessDenied`: The issuer of the product did not grant permission for a transfer or issuance.
- `ProductCantFractionalize`: This product doesn't allow fractionalizable product items.
- `ProductCantInflate`: This product doesn't allow inflatable product items.
- `ProductCantSpendUnassigned`: Spending `Unassigned` holdings is not allowed for this product.
- `ProductIsDeleted`: This product doesn't allow any interaction as it is deleted.
- `ProductItemCantInflate`: An inflate transaction was attempted on a product item that does not allow inflation.
- `ProductItemIsDeleted`: The referenced product item is deleted.
- `ProductItemNotFound`: The referenced product item does not exist.
- `ProductItemRequiresUnderlying`: Creating a product item for this product requires a baked holding for each of the required products.
- `ProductItemsMustBeSameProduct`: When re-assigning holdings to a different Product Item, the product item must be of the same product.
- `ProductNotFound`: The referenced product does not exist.
- `QuantityOverflow`: The exact quantity computed overflows its type.
- `RequestAccessDenied`: The request was not signed by parties with sufficient access.
- `RequiresInitialAmount`: Non-inflatable product items require an initial amount.
- `SecurityGroupIsDeleted`: The selected security group has been deleted.
- `SecurityGroupNotFound`: The requested security group does not exist.
- `TransactionHasBeenProcessed`: Duplicate transaction id. A transaction with this id has already been processed.
- `UnderlyingNotAllowedForUnassigned`: Unassigned product items cannot have underlying baked holdings.
- `UnsupportedTransactionRequest`: The type of transaction request was not supported by this system.

message.description: Optionally, an additional error message text.

subSystem.description: The subsystem that failed the processing.

txId.description: The transaction id from the request.

systemId.description: Unique SystemId that the transaction request is signed for. The SystemId can be retrieved from the config endpoint.

txId.description: Informational transaction id, the transaction id is actually the hash of the request.

MintTransactionResponse.description:
Response to a (successful) transaction request.
 The response contains the blockNumber and indexInBlock of the processed transaction as well as basic information
 about holdings that were spent and issued by the transaction.

accountId.description: Account to which this response applies.

blockNumber.description: Block number that the transaction is committed in.

issuedHoldings.description: Holdings that were issued in this transaction (to this account).

spentHoldings.description: Holdings that were spent in this transaction.

pendingCount.description: Number of pending requests for this key.

PendingSignatureData.description: A data structure to retrieve pending signatures and data about the transaction request.

accountAccessType.description: Type of account access for this access key.

accountRoleType.description: Role of this user account for the request account.

metadata.description: Metadata for this transaction if requested with `includeMetadata`.

rejectedBy.description: The signatures that rejected the transaction.

request.description: Decoded transaction request for thin clients.

signedBy.description: Other signatures already present on the pending transaction.

userAccessType.description: Type of user at the time of the transaction.

ProductBalanceData.description:
Balance data for a particular product.
 When querying the 'effect' of a transaction or collection of transactions on a particular grouping, the result contains
 separate totals for the different amounts (depending on the holding state).
 The `amount` represents a transaction amount, i.e. the total of the transacted amounts.
 The other amounts represent 'net' balance movements, where a negative amount signifies a net debit and a positive amount
 signifies a net credit.

amount.description: Absolute (i.e., greater than 0) amount of transactions.

assignedAmount.description: Net assigned amount (including with amounts assigned to issuer).

productIds.description: List of product ids that are match this condition. The transfer context must contain one of these products to match.

ProductData.description:
Detail for a Product. Products are identified by the block-and-index of the transaction that originally created them.
 Additionally, there's a version that indicates the version of the product's definition. The version is the block-and-index
 of the SetAttribute transaction that updated the product's attributes.

ProductTransferCondition.description:
Matches a transfer of a specific product.
 If toAccountIds or toAccountGroupIds are specified, the condition matches the toAccount of the transfer context.
 If neither toAccountIds nor toAccountGroupIds are specified, the condition matches any account.

accountGroups.description:
When present, the corresponding filter must have a value and any referenced entity must be in this list.
 When absent, the condition does not check this type of reference (i.e. any reference of this type is allowed).
 To ensure no entities of this type are referenced, set to an empty list.

accounts.description:
When present, the corresponding filter must have a value and any accounts specified may only be from this list.
 When absent, the condition does not check this type of reference (i.e. any reference of this type is allowed).
 To ensure no entities of this type are referenced, set to an empty list.

metadata.description:
List of metadata references to match.

 How the references are evaluated depends on the context in which the condition is evaluated. In the normal
 transaction or endpoint context for Request permissions, the condition has the 'filter' semantic where a request
 MUST contain metadata references from the permitted list and can not be empty. i.e.,

 - When present, the corresponding filter must have a value and any metadata refs may only be from this list.
 - When absent, the condition does not check this type of reference (i.e. any reference of this type is allowed).
 - To ensure no entities of this type are referenced, set to an empty list.

 The filtering semantic is used when using this condition to permit Issuer (i.e. Metadata) API itself.

 When an Account / Inventory API endpoint is used with `includeMetadata` or metadata sorts and filters, the response
 will include the values for the metadata requested. To ensure that private issuer metadata is allowed to be requested
 the system checks for a `Product` permission with a special 'endpoint owner' context. The private metadata references
 are grouped by issuer and each issuer needs to grant `Product` permission for the request. If there are no
 metadata references in the request, no issuers are checked for Product permission.

onlyUserAccount.description:
When `true`, the account(s) request parameter must be present and must only contain the authenticated user account.
 When `false`, the account request parameter is ignored.

onlyVisibleAccountGroups.description:
When `true`, the account group request parameter must be present and must only contain groups that are visible
 to the requesting user account.
 When `false`, the account group request parameter is ignored.

productItems.description:
When present, the corresponding filter must have a value and any referenced entity must be in this list.
 When absent, the condition does not check this type of reference (i.e. any reference of this type is allowed).
 To ensure no entities of this type are referenced, set to an empty list.

products.description:
When present, the corresponding filter must have a value and any referenced entity must be in this list.
 When absent, the condition does not check this type of reference (i.e. any reference of this type is allowed).
 To ensure no entities of this type are referenced, set to an empty list.

securityGroups.description:
When present, the corresponding filter must have a value and any referenced entity must be in this list.
 When absent, the condition does not check this type of reference (i.e. any reference of this type is allowed).
 To ensure no entities of this type are referenced, set to an empty list.

RequiredRefCondition.description:
Match references to different types of entities in the request parameters.
 This condition can be applied to both Transaction contexts and Endpoint contexts.

 The condition matches when the expression for each entity type matches.
 If an expression is given for a particular entity type, then that type of entity
 must be supported by the transaction type or endpoint type. This ensures that a statement will not match if
 it doesn't restrict the correct endpoint types.

 The semantic here is that for transactions you can only operate on particular entity parameters, and all other values
 are denied but the request can contain a subset as long as the subset is not empty.
 For endpoint parameters, the condition forces the use of a filter criterion (effectively disallowing requests that
 don't filter by a particular type) and restricts the values that can be used in the filter.

 | Condition parameter | Request value | Result |
 |-|-|-|
 | null (absent) | X | ☑ match |
 | null (absent) | [] or null | ☑ match |
 | null (absent) | unsupported | ☑ match |
 | [] | X | - no match |
 | [] | [] or null | ☑ match |
 | [] | unsupported | - no match |
 | [X, ...] | Y | - no match |
 | [X, ...] | X | ☑ match |
 | [X, ...] | [X, Y, ...] | - no match |
 | [X, ...] | [] or null | - no match |
 | [X, ...] | unsupported | - no match |

SetAttributeRequest.description:
Set, update, or remove one or more attributes on a [EntityRefType.Product]/[EntityRefType.ProductItem],[EntityRefType.SecurityGroup], [EntityRefType.AccountGroup].

 Each entity that can be updated has a version reference. The version reference is the block-and-index of the
 transaction that last changed the entity, which is either the transaction that created the entity for the initial
 version, or the last attribute update transaction.

 To ensure consistent updates when multiple clients may be updating the same entities, specify the last known version
 in the `VersionEntityRef` of the entity. If a `null` version is specified, the system will not check the version of
 the entity when updating.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `SetAttributeRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | Neither `setAttributes` nor `removeAttributes` contain a value. |
 | [InvalidSetAttributeRequest] | The referenced entity does not support attribute updates. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute, or `setAttributes`, is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [InvalidEnum] | The value used for an enumerated attribute is not defined. |
 | [DisabledEnum] | The value used for an enumerated attribute is not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | Requester is not the issuer of the entity |
 | [MissingAttributeRequired] | Missing required attribute. |
 | [AttributeNotAllowed] | The request contains a forbidden attribute. |

data.description:
Actual metadata value

 MetadataValueJsonData,

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the transaction itself.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

SetMultiAttributeRequest.description:
Set, update, or remove one or more attributes on multiple Entities of type [EntityRefType.Product]/[EntityRefType.ProductItem],[EntityRefType.SecurityGroup], [EntityRefType.AccountGroup].

 Each entity that can be updated has a version reference. The version reference is the block-and-index of the
 transaction that last changed the entity, which is either the transaction that created the entity for the initial
 version, or the last attribute update transaction.

 To ensure consistent updates when multiple clients may be updating the same entities, specify the last known version
 in the `VersionEntityRef` of the entity. If a `null` version is specified, the system will not check the version of
 the entity when updating.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `SetMultiAttributeRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | Neither `setAttributes` nor `removeAttributes` contain a value. |
 | [InvalidSetAttributeRequest] | A referenced entity does not support attribute updates. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute, or `setAttributes`, is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [InvalidEnum] | The ordinal or name referenced as an enum value is not valid. |
 | [DisabledEnum] | The referenced enum value is disabled. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | Requester is not the issuer of the entity |
 | [MissingAttributeRequired] | Missing required attribute. |
 | [AttributeNotAllowed] | The request contains a forbidden attribute. |

 If issued holdings (and baked holdings) are returned, this is the 'selfHoldingsHash'.

TransactionRequest.description:
Transaction request structure. Every transaction processed by the mint has a corresponding transaction request structure.
 The `type` field specifies the request type and determines the fields of the request.
 
 #### Attribute errors
 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [MissingAttributeRequired] | Missing required attribute |
 | [AttributeNotAllowed] | The request contains a forbidden attribute |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | Attribute's value does not match the requirements of its definition |
 | [InvalidAttributeRule] | A transaction signature failed to verify (i.e., the signature does not match the data that was to be signed)|
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | Referenced attribute does not exist |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | Referenced attribute does not exist |
 | [InvalidEnum] | The ordinal or name referenced as an enum value is not valid. |
 | [DisabledEnum] | The referenced enum value is disabled |

TransferEscrowRequest.description:
Transfer existing escrowed holdings to another holder while retaining the escrow state.
 The holdings will be assigned to a single new escrowId.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `TransferEscrowRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `controllerId` field.

 In addition, the new `toAccountId` needs to be assigned `Product` permission by the issuer of the product for this request.

 In addition, if a new `toControllerId` is assigned, the new controller must have assigned `Controller` permission
 to the existing controller for this request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The controller account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [ProductAccessDenied] | The issuer of the product did not grant permission for the transfer. |
 | [ControllerAccessDenied] | The prospective new controller did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ValueHasTooManyDigits] | An amount in the holding selector exceeds maximum precision. |
 | [NonPositiveTransferAmount] | An amount in the holding selector is negative or zero. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute, or `setAttributes`, is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InsufficientHoldings] | Insufficient amount to transfer |
 | [EscrowNotFound] | A referenced escrow ID does not exist, or is not assigned to this controller. |
 | [QuantityOverflow] | The exact quantity computed overflows its type. |
 | [HoldingAccessDenied] | The specified holding is not owned by the requester's account |
 | [HoldingsMustBeSameProduct] | Referenced holdings must be from the same product. |
 | [HoldingIsEscrowed] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was already locked. |
 | [HoldingIsUnassigned] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was not assigned yet. |
 | [HoldingIsNotUnassigned] | An attempt was made to assign a holding that was already assigned. |
 | [NotMultipleOfUnitAmount] | The amount specified needs to be an integer multiple of the `unitAmount` of the product item. |

TransferReceivedNotification.description: Notifies accounts that new holdings were received.

attributes.description: Transfer attributes.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

outputList.description: List of requested outputs. All entries in the list are processed atomically.

TransferRequest.description:
Request to transfer partial holdings.

 The `fromAccountId` needs to have sufficient holdings to be transferred. Each entry in the outputList can contain
 a different recipient accountId and holdings can be selected based on amount or specific holdings. Attributes can
 be attached to the transfer, which will be visible to the recipient.

 A nonce may be added to be able to repeat a transfer with the same parameters (which would otherwise be seen as
 a retry of a previous request).

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `TransferRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `fromAccountId` field.

 In addition, the `toAccountId` needs to be assigned `Product` permission by the issuer of the product for each transfer entry in the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The from account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [ProductAccessDenied] | The issuer of the product did not grant permission for the transfer. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | The request contains no `outputList` entries. |
 | [ValueHasTooManyDigits] | An amount in the holding selector exceeds maximum precision. |
 | [NonPositiveTransferAmount] | An amount in the holding selector is negative or zero. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute, or `setAttributes`, is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InsufficientHoldings] | Insufficient amount to transfer |
 | [EscrowNotFound] | A referenced escrow ID does not exist, or is not assigned to this controller. |
 | [QuantityOverflow] | The exact quantity computed overflows its type. |
 | [HoldingAccessDenied] | The specified holding is not owned by the requester's account |
 | [HoldingsMustBeSameProduct] | Referenced holdings must be from the same product. |
 | [HoldingIsEscrowed] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was already locked. |
 | [HoldingIsUnassigned] | An attempt was made to select an 'input' holding that was not assigned yet. |
 | [HoldingIsNotUnassigned] | An attempt was made to assign a holding that was already assigned. |
 | [NotMultipleOfUnitAmount] | The amount specified needs to be an integer multiple of the `unitAmount` of the product item. |

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `UpdateAccountAccessRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `forAccountId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | The request contains no `updates` entries. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute, or `setAttributes`, is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | [AccessUpdateContainsDuplicateAccountKey] | The access update request contains duplicate account ids |
 | [AccessUpdateCausingPermanentAccessLossNotAllowed] | The access update request causes permanent access loss to the target account |

accessType.description:
When set, the access type of the account group is updated. The owner can set any access type,
 except [UserAccessType.OperatorAccess] which can only be set if the owner of the group
 is the Issuer Admin account.

addAccounts.description: Accounts to add to the group.

removeAccounts.description: Accounts to remove from the group.

setAccounts.description: Replace all group members with the given list. If `setAccounts` is set (even set empty), neither `addAccounts` nor `removeAccounts` may be set.

versionId.description: Optionally, a version to check. If specified and the version does not match the group's current version, the request will fail.

visibleToMembersOf.description:
Update the 'visible to members of' account group.
 There is only one 'visible to members of' account group, so the list can only contain 0 or 1 entries.
 0 entries to remove the current 'visibleToMembersOf' account group, 1 to set a different one.

attributes.description: Transaction attributes.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

ownerId.description: The owner of the account group.

updates.description: Non-empty list of updates to perform.

UpdateAccountGroupsRequest.description:
Update the members of an account group.
 Multiple account groups can be updated in a single request. Each entry can add members, remove members or replace
 all the members with a new list.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `UpdateAccountGroupsRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `ownerId` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | Empty list of updates, or the request contains an empty update. |
 | [EmptyOptionalList] | Optional lists in the request should be absent or `null` instead of `[]`. |
 | [MixingAddRemoveWithSet] | The request mixes the `add`/`remove` pattern with the 'set' pattern. |
 | [BothAddAndRemove] | The request removes an entity that it just added. |
 | [ListExceedsLimit] | The `visibleToMembersOf` list is limited to a single account group ID. |
 | [DuplicateAccountGroupId] | A list of account group IDs contains a duplicate entry. |
 | [DuplicateAccountId] | A list of account IDs contains a duplicate entry. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | Requester is not the owner of the account group. |
 | [IncorrectVersion] | The request was made with an outdated version. |
 | [AccountGroupNotFound] | Referenced account group does not exist. |
 | [AccountGroupIsDeleted] | Referenced account group has been deleted. |

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the transaction.

issuerId.description: Target account that issued the attribute.

maxCount.description: Lists maximum count. If the attribute is not a list cannot be changed.

minCount.description: Lists minimum count. If the attribute is not a list cannot be changed.

nonce.description:
Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.
 Using the version field instead of a nonce will ensure updates are 'safe'.

ref.description: Attribute reference, unique within the system.

version.description:
Last known version of the attribute definition. If the version is set, and it does not equal the actual
 current version of the attribute's definition, the transaction will fail.

UpdateAttributeDefinitionRequest.description:
Update an attribute definition.
 Only the attribute definition [validationRules] and if it's a list, [minCount] and [maxCount] can be updated.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `DefineAttributeRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `issuerId` account did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeRule] | A rule defined for the new attribute is not valid. |
 | [NotAListAttribute] | The update changes `minCount` or `maxCount` but the attribute is not a list. |
 | [EmptyRequest] | The request contains no updates. |
 | [InvalidAttributeRule] | A rule defined for the new attribute is not valid. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectVersion] | The requested version is not the current version of the attribute definition. |

addValues.description: List of enums to add to the attribute.

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the transaction.

disableValues.description: List of enums to disable from the attribute. These enums will still exist in the system but not be available for use.

enableValues.description: List of enums to enable from the attribute. This enums will be available for use again.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

ref.description: Reference to an attribute of type [AttributeType.ENUMERATED].

updatedBy.description: Account updating the attribute enums. Only the account that created an enumerated attribute can update its values.

UpdateEnumValuesRequest.description:
Set, or remove enumerators for an enumerated attribute.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `UpdateEnumValuesRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `updatedBy` field.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|

 | [AttributeIsNotEnum] | The referenced attribute is not an enum. |
 | [EmptyOptionalList] | Optional lists in the request should be absent or `null` instead of `[]`. |
 | [EmptyRequest] | The request contains no updates. |
 | [DuplicateEnumValueDef] | The `addValues` contains duplicate definitions of either name or ordinal. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |

account.description:
Tenant owner account. The account field here has to be the owner of the tenant referenced in this same request.
 It is also the account that has to be the requesting account, as only the tenant owner can effect changes within the tenant.

additionalApplicationIds.description: Additional application IDs (used to set more than one applicationId)

applicationId.description: Application ID (the aud claim of the access token will be validated against this value, an empty value will disable this validation).

attributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the request.

enabled.description: Enable or not this identity provider (not effective if the issuerUri is used in other identity providers and aud claim validation is disabled).

id.description: Internal ID of the identity provider to update.

identityProviderAttributes.description: Optionally, attributes can be associated with the identity provider.

issuerUri.description: Issuer URI (must provide an openid discovery endpoint).

migrateFromSubjectIdClaim.description:
Name of the claim the Identity Provider is migrating from when updating the [tokenSubjectIdClaim].
 When updating the [tokenSubjectIdClaim], a migration from the previous or default [tokenSubjectIdClaim] might be needed
 if there are already users authenticating with this Identity Provider.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

responseType.description: Authentication flow response type. One of or combination of: id_token, none, code, token (except none, values can be combined). See https://openid.net/specs/oauth-v2-multiple-response-types-1_0.html#OAuthResponseTypesReg

tokenSubjectIdClaim.description: Name of the claim used by the identity provider token to identity a user. If none is set, the default will be "sub".

version.description: Version of the identity provider in the repository.

visible.description: Control the visibility of this identity provider via the configuration endpoint. Setting an identity provider to visible=false does not disable it. Defaults to "true".

UpdateIdentityProviderRequest.description:
Tenant owner updates identity provider.

 This transaction request is processed by the Tenant API itself and not forwarded to the mint-service. Therefore, it
 must be submitted to the [CoreTenantApi.identityProviderConfigRequest] endpoint instead of the normal transaction endpoints.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `UpdateIdentityProviderRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `account` field.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `account` account did not grant permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction or provider attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction or provider attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction or provider attribute was not defined. |

 #### Wallet host errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [WalletHostErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [TenantOwnerIncorrect] | The referenced tenant owner is not the owner of the referenced tenant  |
 | [TenantIdUnknown] | Referenced tenant does not exist  |
 | [IdentityProviderWithMatchingIssuerUriExists] | An identity provider with this issuer URI already exists. |
 | [IdentityProviderVersionInvalid] | Identity provider request version does not match repository version |

UpdateProductRequest.description:
Allows to add or update product item attributes and updating the list of underlying products.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `UpdateProductRequest`, assigned by the
 request account in the `issuerId` field.

 In addition, the Issuer Administrator account must have assigned `Issuer` permission to the `issuerId` account for the request.

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [RequestAccessDenied] | The `issuerId` account did not grant permission for the request. |
 | [IssuerAccessDenied] | The Issuer administrator did not grant `Issuer` permission for the request. |

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [DuplicateUnderlyingProduct] | Duplicated underlying product |
 | [DuplicateAttributeRule] | Duplicated attribute |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A transaction attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [MintServiceErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [ProductIsDeleted] | Referenced product is deleted |
 | [ProductNotFound] | Referenced product not found |

message.description:
The status message to return for the current system state. If no message is given,
 the previous message for this state will be used.

nonce.description: Request can include a nonce to distinguish between different requests with the same data.

requestAccount.description: The request account must be the Issuer Admin account.

startTime.description:
Planned start of this system state. If not specified, the state will change immediately (i.e. current time). If
 specified, it must be a future time.

UpdateSystemStateRequest.description:
Update the system state.

 The system state determines which user types are allowed to access the system.
 The system state can only be updated by the Issuer Admin account (or its delegates).

 This transaction request is processed by the Tenant API itself and not forwarded to the mint-service. Therefore, it
 must be submitted to the [CoreTenantApi.updateSystemState] endpoint instead of the normal transaction endpoints.

 #### Transaction permission

 This transaction request requires `Request` permission for transaction type `UpdateSystemStateRequest`, assigned by the
 issuer admin.

 #### Validation errors

 Validation of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [EmptyRequest] | Empty list of updates, or the request contains an empty update. |
 | [InvalidAttributeValue] | The value for a transaction attribute is not valid given the attribute definition. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByTag] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |
 | [AttributeNotFoundByName] | A referenced attribute was not defined. |

 #### Mint service errors

 Processing of this transaction request may result in one of the following errors from [CoreApiErrorCode]:

 | Error | Cause |
 |:----|:----|
 | [IncorrectIssuer] | The request account is not the issuer admin account. |

accessToken.description:
The Authorization header supports two types of token:
          - Bearer token from a configured Tenant Identity Provider. The format is the `Bearer` scheme prefix followed by the token.
          - Access token signed with a core AccessKey. Format is `X-Trovio-AccessToken` scheme prefix followed by a Base64-URLEncoded `SignedAccessToken` structure.
accessToken.name: Authorization
